WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?
A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: Mrs. Clara McVey
Address: 414-112 St. B, Saskatoon
Birthplace: Northport, Maine, U.S.A.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS
What year did you start housekeeping in Eastern Canada? 1906
Where did you set up housekeeping? In N.E. of Regina
Where had you been living before that? Lawrence, M.S.A.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 4
How far was it to your nearest store? 9 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Once a week, sometimes a month
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Flour, sugar.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS
What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Robin Hood
mainly tried other kinds, but always went back to R.H.
In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lbs at a time
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? I forget
How much did you use graham flour? 50 lbs
Whole wheat flour? None
Was flour milled locally? No
How far away? What year? I do not remember
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? I do not remember
What other grain products did you use? Ground for flour, coffee meal
Cornmeal? Yes
Whole wheat? Yes
Farina? No
Other?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes
How did you grind it? With the Coffee Mill, wore it out
McVeigh, Mrs. Orr.
211 - 13th St., E.
Saskatoon, Sask.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

Menne for Breakfast, would be Eggs, buttered toast and wheat coffee, also whole-wheat porridge, if wanted.
Dinner, potatoes, gravy, Bread & butter perhaps eggs.
Supper - potatoes, beans, maybe bread pudding (if there was enough milk beside what the children drank).

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Western Canada? 1904. Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

Menne - Chicken, gravy, potatoes, beans, canned wild strawberries, cake. Mr. McVeigh age 26 - myself 24
Ray age 5 - Velma age 3 - Leone age 5 months.
My Father, Mother, my brother & sister (twins) 12 yrs old.
My Mother-in-law and Brother-in-law, 16 years old.

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

Never really went hungry, but did get hungry for variety, change. The worst was just bread, beans & wheat coffee, but not for too long.

Sorry I could not remember about prices but we really did not buy much at store; in the early years, we plowed furrows and planted potatoes by plowing next furrow on them to cover them. They grew large size but flat. Planted them first thing the first spring here, also managed to raise pretty good garden in the sod. Lived in tent until we got these things done and got our shack / Barn up by fall.
